item.title: Facebook Owner Meta to Buy Nuclear Power From Constellation as AI Demand Soars
item.description: Constellation Energy Corp. agreed to sell power from an operating Illinois nuclear plant to Meta Platforms Inc., a deal that could spur construction of a new reactor at the site as artificial intelligence sends power demand soaring.
item.dc:creator: Will Wade, Riley Griffin

media:content.media:description: The Clinton Power Station in Clinton, Illinois, in 2016. Photographer: John Dixon/The News-Gazette/AP

item.title: TSMC Flags Delays in Japan Expansion While US Plans Advance
item.description: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. Chief Executive Officer C. C. Wei blamed worsening traffic snarls for delays in expanding its base in southwestern Japan, even while a parallel US effort races ahead.
item.dc:creator: Debby Wu

media:content.media:description: C. C. Wei at the meeting in Hsinchu, Taiwan. Photographer: An Rong Xu/Bloomberg

item.title: AI Drug Startup Touts Promising Advance in Treating Lung Disease
item.description: A drug developed using artificial intelligence showed signs of efficacy in treating an incurable lung disease in what its developer calls a clinical first.
item.dc:creator: Amber Tong

media:content.media:description: Alex Zhavoronkov at Insilico Medicine's research facility in Suzhou, China. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: Xiaomi Founder Expects EV Arm to Turn Profitable After New SUV
item.description: Xiaomi Corp. founder Lei Jun expects its year-old EV business to turn profitable in the second half, a milestone for the billionaire’s $10 billion endeavor in a cut-throat market.
item.dc:creator: Yuan Gao, Jessica Sui, Linda Lew

media:content.media:description: A Xiaomi Corp. SU7 electric vehicle on display at a store in Shanghai.

item.title: Prosus Chief Investment Officer Ervin Tu to Step Down
item.description: Prosus NV’s President and Chief Investment Officer Ervin Tu will step down from his role after a nearly four-year tenure during which the South African-Dutch tech investment company restructured itself and appointed a new chief executive officer.
item.dc:creator: Loni Prinsloo

item.title: AI Pioneer Launches Research Group to Help Build Safer Agents
item.description: Yoshua Bengio, an artificial intelligence pioneer, is creating a new nonprofit research organization to promote an alternative approach to developing cutting-edge AI systems, with the aim of mitigating the technology’s potential risks. The nonprofit, called LawZero, is set to launch Tuesday with $30 million in backing from one of former Google Chief Executive Officer Eric Schmidt’s philanthropic organizations and Skype co-founder Jaan Tallinn, among others. Bengio will lead a team of more than 1
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Yoshua Bengio, founder and scientific director of Mila at the Quebec AI Institute, during the All In event in Montreal, Quebec, Canada, on Wednesday, Sept. 27, 2023. The event aims to connect people to real-life applications of Canadian AI in business, research and ethical pursuits.

item.title: Philippine Fintech GCash to Split Stocks Ahead of Possible IPO
item.description: The company behind the Philippines’ top mobile wallet GCash has approved a stock split to increase the number of its common shares amid plans for an initial public offering.
item.dc:creator: Neil Jerome Morales, Cliff Harvey Venzon

media:content.media:description: A customer adds credit to his mobile phone by using a Globe Telecom Inc. GCash top-up machine in Taguig city, Metro Manila, the Philippines, on Monday, Oct. 23, 2017. Globe is tapping its partnership with Chinese Billionaire Jack Ma’s Ant Financial for capital, expertise and technology, Cu said in an interview. Photographer: Veejay Villafranca/Bloomberg

item.title: Tom Cruise’s ‘Mission Impossible’ Tops China Box Office
item.description: Tom Cruise’s film is back on top in China. Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning posted the biggest opening for a US film in the country this year, defying trade and geopolitical tensions between Washington and Beijing.
item.dc:creator: Sohee Kim

media:content.media:description: Tom Cruise in London for the Global Premiere of Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning on May 15.

item.title: Australia Cracks Down on Crypto ATMs as Scams, Fraud Uncovered
item.description: Australia’s financial crimes agency placed curbs on cryptocurrency automatic teller machines as the surging number of kiosks increasingly attract fraudsters and scammers.
item.dc:creator: Richard Henderson

media:content.media:description: Signage for Bitcoin cryptocurrency on a cryptocurrency ATM in Hong Kong, China, on Wednesday, Nov. 6, 2024. Bitcoin jumped to a record as traders around the world watched results trickle in from a US presidential election that pits digital-asset supporter Donald Trump against Kamala Harris, who served as vice president during a government crackdown on the industry. Photographer: Lam Yik/Bloomberg

item.title: China’s Rare Earths Grip Gives Xi Leverage in US Trade Duel
item.description: After the US and China agreed in Geneva to lower tariffs from astronomical heights, tensions are now surging over access to chips and rare earths. And Beijing increasingly appears to have an edge.
item.dc:creator: Martin Ritchie, Jing Li, Tyler Kendall

item.title: Musk Taps Investors for Billions Days After Washington Exit
item.description: Elon Musk is selling $5 billion in debt for his artificial intelligence startup, xAI Corp., the latest in a series of fundraising efforts across his business empire as the billionaire pivots away from politics and returns to running his various companies.
item.dc:creator: Jeannine Amodeo, Kurt Wagner, Jill R Shah

media:content.media:description: Elon Musk Photographer: Kevin Dietsch/Getty Images

item.title: Paramount’s New Board Members Include Ex-Judge, Attorney
item.description: Paramount Global, the owner of CBS and MTV, nominated three new members to its board of directors and one stepped down, bringing the total to seven as the media and entertainment company faces a lawsuit from the US president and seeks merger approval.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miller

media:content.media:description: The Paramount Studios in Los Angeles, California, US, on Tuesday, Aug. 27, 2024. Producer David Ellison's Skydance Media is set to become the new owner of Paramount Global after Seagram Co. heir Edgar Bronfman Jr. dropped out, ending one of the industry's most dramatic acquisition contests.

item.title: Uber Promotes Company Veteran to COO as CEO Says He’s Not Going ‘Anywhere’
item.description: Uber Technologies Inc. named longtime executive Andrew Macdonald as its first chief operating officer since 2019, part of an executive shake-up that includes the departure of the company’s top delivery leader.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: Andrew Macdonald in Toronto in 2022. Photographer: Sam Barnes/Sportfile/Getty Images

item.title: Microsoft Cuts Hundreds More Jobs After Firing 6,000 Last Month
item.description: Microsoft Corp. cut hundreds more jobs just weeks after its largest layoff in years, underscoring the tech industry’s efforts to trim costs even as it plows billions of dollars into artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Signage outside the Microsoft campus in Mountain View, California, US, on Tuesday, Jan 28, 2025. Microsoft Corp. is scheduled to release earnings figures on January 29.

item.title: Tesla Under Pressure, Big Tech Bolsters S&P 500 | Bloomberg Technology 6/2/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses the latest trade tensions between the US and China and the impact they are having on tech. Plus, Tesla is under pressure as sales fall aggressively in France, and Elon Musk pivots his focus back to the company. And, Big Tech is driving S&P 500 growth again. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Clearlake Overhauls Debt, Gets Fresh Capital for Quest Software
item.description: A deal to provide Clearlake Capital Group-backed Quest Software Inc. with $350 million of fresh capital to help fund its artificial intelligence and growth plans is coming at the expense of some lenders who will be pushed down the repayment line.
item.dc:creator: Reshmi Basu

item.title: Grindr’s Abrupt Return to Office Was ‘Union Busting,’ NLRB Lawyer Tells Judge
item.description: Grindr Inc. changed its remote-work policy “out of the blue,” demanding employees return to the office in retaliation for a union drive after previously telling them they could keep teleworking, US labor board prosecutors told an agency judge.
item.dc:creator: Josh Eidelson

media:content.media:description: A banner for Grindr outside the New York Stock Exchange in New York City.

item.title: Shift4 Leadership in Flux as Trump Pulls CEO’s NASA Nomination
item.description: Taylor Lauber was preparing to start his new job as chief executive officer of Shift4 Payments Inc. soon, as the company’s founder and current CEO got ready to head to Washington to lead NASA under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Emily Mason

media:content.media:description: Jared Isaacman speaks during a Senate committee’s confirmation hearing in Washington in April.

item.title: McKinsey Leans On AI to Make PowerPoints, Draft Proposals
item.description: McKinsey & Co.’s consultants are increasingly drafting proposals and making PowerPoint slides using the firm’s generative artificial intelligence platform, which has developed enough to take over at least some of the tasks typically performed by junior employees.
item.dc:creator: Omar El Chmouri

item.title: Ukraine Building Drone Hunters as Fight Moves Far Beyond Front
item.description: A battle is shaping up in the skies over Ukraine and Russia, as the ingenuity of drone engineers on both sides opens up new opportunities and threats far behind the front lines.
item.dc:creator: Olesia Safronova, Aliaksandr Kudrytski

media:content.media:description: An Iranian-designed Shahed 136 drone, used in Russia under the name Geran-2, on display in Kyiv.

item.title: Delivery Hero Hit by €329 Million EU Fine for Glovo Cartel
item.description: Delivery Hero SE agreed to pay a total of €329 million ($376 million) to settle a European Union probe into collusion with Glovo before it sealed a takeover of its Spanish rival.
item.dc:creator: Samuel Stolton

media:content.media:description: Food couriers working for Glovo on a street in Palma de Mallorca. Photographer: Andrey Rudakov/Bloomberg

item.title: Amazon Hit by German Warning Over Price Controls on Marketplace
item.description: Amazon.com Inc. was warned by Germany’s antitrust watchdog that price controls for retailers on its marketplace are likely to violate national and European Union laws.
item.dc:creator: Karin Matussek

media:content.media:description: Amazon packages ready for dispatch at a distribution center in Germany.

item.title: India, Russia-Backed Economic Bloc to Begin Free Trade Talks
item.description: India and the Moscow-backed Eurasian Economic Union will begin trade talks this year, a Russian official said, at a time when the South Asian nation is also pursuing ambitious trade deals with the US and the European Union.
item.dc:creator: Sudhi Ranjan Sen

media:content.media:description: Gantry cranes and shipping containers at Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone Ltd. in Mundra, Gujarat.

item.title: Nvidia-Backed Cloud Operator Nebius Raises $1 Billion in Debt
item.description: Nebius Group NV, the technology company spun out from Russian internet giant Yandex, has raised $1 billion in convertible debt to help fuel its expansion into next year.
item.dc:creator: Mark Bergen

item.title: Tesla’s Robotaxi Faces Key Month of Testing and Rollout
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow checks in on Elon Musk’s accelerating plans for a Tesla robotaxi service.
item.dc:creator: Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: A Tesla Cybercab prototype at a Tesla store in San Jose, California, US, on Tuesday, Nov. 12, 2024. Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the robotaxi, which has no steering wheel or pedals, could cost less than $30,000 and "probably" will go into production in 2026.

item.title: Andreessen Horowitz in Deal Talks Valuing Abridge AI at $5.3 Billion
item.description: The startup is raising $300 million for software that takes notes on conversations with doctors and patients.
item.dc:creator: Kate Clark

media:content.media:description: Shiv Rao, co-founder and chief executive officer of Abridge AI Inc., during the Forbes Healthcare Summit in New York, US, on Tuesday, Dec. 5, 2023. The summit will cover topics including ChatGPT's capabilities, advanced technology to treat the whole person, recent breakthroughs in biopharma, and the role of human compassion and empathy in the system.

item.title: BYD Shares Sink as Carmaker Faces Backlash Over EV Price War
item.description: BYD Co. shares fell, bringing losses over the past week to more than 17%, on concern that its price cuts are drawing government scrutiny and becoming unsustainable for the Chinese EV industry.
item.dc:creator: Linda Lew

item.title: Why It's So Hard for Apple to Move Production From China to India
item.description: Or anywhere else.
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

media:content.media:description: A customer looks at an Apple iPhone 16 Pro Max smartphone at the Apple Inc. BKC store in Mumbai, India, on Friday, Sept. 20, 2024. Apple launched the iPhone 16 lineup in almost 60 countries on Friday. But the device won't come installed with Apple Intelligence the much-anticipated AI software that the company has been touting since June. Photographer: Bloomberg/Bloomberg

item.title: Odd Lots: Why It’s Hard for Apple to Move Out of China (Podcast)
item.description: President Trump wants Apple to make iPhones in America. The company itself has talked about — and to some extent already has been — moving more of its production to other countries, like India. But in reality, Apple remains deeply, deeply enmeshed in the Chinese supply chain. In fact, the rise of Apple, and the iPhone specifically, is the ultimate example of the link between the American and Chinese economies. And while this has been fruitful for shareholders all around the world, and contribute
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

media:content.media:description: Apple Inc Photographer: Craig Warga/Bloomberg

item.title: Telkom Indonesia Is Said to Weigh Sale of Health-Care Firm AdMedika
item.description: PT Telekomunikasi Indonesia is considering selling AdMedika and seeking at least $100 million for the health-care firm, according to people familiar with the situation.
item.dc:creator: Elffie Chew, Dong Cao

media:content.media:description: A visitor uses a smartphone in Jakarta, Indonesia.
